input:
Although they ran at about the same speed, Sue beat Sally because she had such a bad start. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Sue
(B) Sally

I saw Jim yelling at some guy in a military uniform with a huge red beard. I don't know who he was, but he looked very unhappy. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Jim
(B) the guy in uniform

Madonna fired her trainer because she couldn't stand her boyfriend. What does the pronoun "her" refer to?
(A) Madonna
(B) The trainer

The foxes are getting in at night and attacking the chickens. I shall have to kill them . What does the pronoun "them" refer to?
(A) The foxes
(B) The chickens

Thomson visited Cooper's grave in 1765. At that date he had been dead for five years. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Thomson
(B) Cooper

The firemen arrived after the police because they were coming from so far away. What does the pronoun "they" refer to?
(A) The firemen
(B) The police

Anne gave birth to a daughter last month. She is a very charming baby. What does the pronoun "She" refer to?
(A) Anne
(B) Anne's daughter

In July, Kamtchatka declared war on Yakutsk. Since Yakutsk's army was much better equipped and ten times larger, they were victorious within weeks. What does the pronoun "they" refer to?
(A) Kamchatka
(B) Yakutsk

The cat was lying by the mouse hole waiting for the mouse, but it was too impatient. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The cat
(B) The mouse

Jim signaled the barman and gestured toward his empty glass What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Jim
(B) The barman

The sack of potatoes had been placed above the bag of flour, so it had to be moved first. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The sack of potatoes
(B) The bag of flour

Fred is the only man alive who still remembers my father as an infant. When Fred first saw my father, he was twelve years old. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Fred
(B) My father

The dog chased the cat, which ran up a tree. It waited at the bottom. What does the pronoun "It" refer to?
(A) The dog
(B) The cat

Dan had to stop Bill from toying with the injured bird. He is very compassionate. What does the pronoun "He" refer to?
(A) Dan
(B) Bill

Fred was supposed to run the dishwasher, but he put it off, because he wanted to watch TV. But the show turned out to be boring, so he changed his mind and turned it off. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The dishwasher
(B) The TV

They broadcast an announcement, but a subway came into the station and I couldn't hear over it . What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The announcement
(B) The subway

The woman held the girl against her will. What does the pronoun "her" refer to?
(A) The woman
(B) The girl

When the sponsors of the bill got to the town hall, they were surprised to find that the room was full of opponents. They were very much in the minority. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) The sponsors
(B) The opponents

Madonna fired her trainer because she slept with her boyfriend. What does the pronoun "her" refer to?
(A) Madonna
(B) The trainer

The police arrested all of the gang members. They were trying to stop the drug trade in the neighborhood. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) The police
(B) The gang members

It was a summer afternoon, and the dog was sitting in the middle of the lawn. After a while, it got up and moved to a spot under the tree, because it was cooler. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The dog
(B) The spot under the tree

The path to the lake was blocked, so we couldn't use it . What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The path
(B) The lake

Sam's drawing was hung just above Tina's and it did look much better with another one below it. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) Sam's drawing
(B) Tina's drawing

Sam broke both his ankles and he's walking with crutches. But a month or so from now they should be better. What does the pronoun "they" refer to?
(A) The ankles
(B) The crutches

Emma did not pass the ball to Janie although she saw that she was open. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Emma
(B) Janie

Joe has sold his house and bought a new one a few miles away. He will be moving out of it on Thursday. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The old house
(B) The new house

The user changed his password from "GrWQWu8JyC" toÂ "willow-towered Canopy Huntertropic wrestles" as it was easy to forget. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) GrWQWu8JyC
(B) willow-towered Canopy Huntertropic wrestles

The scientists are studying three species of fish that have recently been found living in the Indian Ocean. They appeared two years ago. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) The scientists
(B) The fish

I'm sure that my map will show this building; it is very good. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The map
(B) The building

This book introduced Shakespeare to Ovid; it was a major influence on his writing. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Shakespeare
(B) Ovid

My meeting started at 4:00 and I needed to catch the train at 4:30, so there wasn't much time. Luckily, it was short, so it worked out. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The meeting
(B) The train

My meeting started at 4:00 and I needed to catch the train at 4:30, so there wasn't much time. Luckily, it was delayed, so it worked out. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The meeting
(B) The train

George got free tickets to the play, but he gave them to Eric, because he was particularly eager to see it. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) George
(B) Eric

The delivery truck zoomed by the school bus because it was going so fast. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) the delivery truck
(B) the school bus

Everyone really loved the oatmeal cookies; only a few people liked the chocolate chip cookies. Next time, we should make more of them . What does the pronoun "them" refer to?
(A) The oatmeal cookies
(B) The chocolate chip cookies

Grace was happy to trade me her sweater for my jacket. She thinks it looks great on her. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The sweater
(B) The jacket

Bob was playing cards with Adam and was way ahead. If Adam hadn't had a sudden run of good luck, he would have won. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Bob
(B) Adam

Mary tucked her daughter Anne into bed, so that she could sleep. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Mary
(B) Mary's daughter

John couldn't see the stage with Billy in front of him because he is so tall. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) John
(B) Billy

The sculpture rolled off the shelf because it wasn't level. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The sculpture
(B) The shelf

Emma's mother had died long ago, and her education had been managed by an excellent woman as governess. What does the pronoun "her" refer to?
(A) Emma
(B) Emma's mother

Stretching her back, the woman smiled at the girl. What does the pronoun "her" refer to?
(A) The woman
(B) The girl

Pete envies Martin because he is very successful. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Pete
(B) Martin

Susan knows all about Ann's personal problems because she is nosy. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Susan
(B) Ann

The delivery truck zoomed by the school bus because it was going so slow. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) the delivery truck
(B) the school bus

The user changed his password from "GrWQWu8JyC" toÂ "willow-towered Canopy Huntertropic wrestles" as it was easy to remember. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) GrWQWu8JyC
(B) willow-towered Canopy Huntertropic wrestles

Beth didn't get angry with Sally, who had cut her off, because she stopped and counted to ten. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Beth
(B) Sally

I put the butterfly wing on the table and it broke. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The butterfly wing
(B) The table

Emma's mother had died long ago, and her place had been taken by an excellent woman as governess. What does the pronoun "her" refer to?
(A) Emma
(B) Emma's mother

Many people start to read Paul's books and can't put them down. They are gripped because Paul writes so well. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) People
(B) Paul's books
